index.online_plugins_desc: Browse and install plugins from online sources

404.title: 404 - Page Not Found
404.description: Sorry, the page you visited does not exist or is unavailable.

room.desc: Welcome to the web portal of the server chat section (we recommend chatting in-game)

about.subtitle: Learn about the background, origins and open source information of GUGU WebUI.
about.source_desc: GUGU WebUI was originally inspired by the idea that the GUGUbot plugin should have its own WebUI. At that time GUGUbot was still relatively simple, so a dedicated WebUI was not added, but this sparked the idea of building a more general‑purpose WebUI plugin, which eventually became GUGU WebUI, originating from GUGUbot.

projects.gugubot_desc: The original automation bot and chat features that created the need for web management.
projects.cq_desc: Provides QQ‑side message forwarding and integration, extending how the server connects to the outside world.
projects.web_desc: An evolution based on the previous two, focusing on a more modern WebUI management experience.

about.opensource_desc: As an open source project, GUGU WebUI welcomes bug reports, pull requests, documentation updates and localization contributions.
about.thanks_desc: Thanks to all developers and server admins who contributed code, suggestions and testing to GUGU WebUI. Your support keeps this project evolving.

items.mcdr_repo_desc: Provides a rich MCDR plugin ecosystem, forming the foundation of this project’s features.
items.mc_server_info: Base implementation for querying Minecraft server status and player information.
items.codemirror: Provides code highlighting and editing experience for configuration editors.
items.deepseek: Powers some of the intelligent assistant features.
items.tailwind: Utility‑first CSS framework that underpins the current UI design.
items.alpine: Lightweight interaction framework used in the legacy frontend.
items.fontawesome: Icon library used in the legacy interface.
items.vditor: WYSIWYG Markdown editor used in some editing scenarios.

items.looseprince_desc: Feature design, documentation, web design and frontend implementation.
items.xuek66_desc: Code development, maintenance and feature design.
items.feedbackers: All users who provided feedback and testing
items.feedbackers_desc: Filed issues and suggestions during real‑world usage and helped the project improve continuously.
items.cursor: Significantly improved development efficiency during refactors and iterations.
items.contributors_link_desc: See the full contributor list on GitHub.

msg.port_invalid: Port must be a valid number between 1 and 65535
msg.account_required: Super admin account cannot be empty
msg.repo_name_url_required: Repository name and URL cannot be empty
msg.repo_url_official_forbidden: Cannot add the same URL as the official repository
msg.repo_duplicate: Repository name or URL already exists
msg.repo_added_tip: Repository added. Click the save button to persist the configuration.
msg.repo_deleted_tip: Repository deleted. Click the save button to persist the configuration.
msg.mcdr_url_save_success: MCDR plugin repository URL saved successfully
msg.https_need_both_files: To enable HTTPS, you need to provide both certificate and key file paths
msg.https_confirm_text:
Please confirm that you have prepared the SSL certificate and key files, and that the specified paths are correct.

If the files do not exist, the WebUI will fall back to HTTP mode.

Continue?
msg.https_save_success: HTTPS settings saved successfully. They will take effect after restarting the plugin. If the SSL files do not exist, the system will automatically fall back to HTTP mode.

network.title: Network Settings
network.tip: Configure the WebUI network binding. After changing these settings, you need to restart the plugin to apply them.
network.host_hint: Use 127.0.0.1 for local access only, use 0.0.0.0 to allow access from other devices
network.port_hint: Port range: 1-65535. Avoid using ports that are already in use.

https.title: HTTPS Settings
https.tip: Configure HTTPS support for WebUI. You need to provide a valid SSL certificate and key files. Changes take effect after restarting the plugin.
https.enable_desc: Encrypt WebUI traffic with HTTPS to protect your admin interface
https.ssl_tip_1: Make sure the specified certificate and key files actually exist, otherwise the system will automatically fall back to HTTP mode
https.ssl_tip_2: File paths can be absolute (e.g. C:/ssl/cert.pem) or relative (e.g. ./ssl/cert.pem)
https.ssl_tip_3: Relative paths are based on the MCDR root directory
https.ssl_tip_4: Configuration changes take effect only after restarting the plugin
https.cert_hint: Full path to the SSL certificate file, e.g. ./ssl/cert.pem
https.key_hint: Full path to the SSL key file, e.g. ./ssl/key.pem
https.key_pass_hint: If your SSL key file is password protected, enter the password here
https.placeholder_key_pass: If your key file is password protected, enter the password here

account.title: Account Settings
account.super_admin_hint: QQ account with super admin permission

ai.title: AI Model Configuration
ai.model_hint: AI model name, DeepSeek default: deepseek-chat

public_chat.title: Public Chat Page Settings
public_chat.tip: Configure options for the public chat page. These settings affect access and message forwarding behavior.
public_chat.enable_desc: Allow users to access the public chat page
public_chat.enable_to_game_desc: Allow users on the public chat page to send messages into the Minecraft game

verification_expire.title: Verification code expiry
verification_expire.desc: Set validity period of verification code (minutes)

session_expire.title: Session expiry
session_expire.desc: Set validity period of user sessions (hours)

history.title: Chat History Management
history.desc: Manage historical messages of the chat page

repo.title: MCDR Plugin Repository Configuration
repo.tip: Supports multiple repository links. You can add third-party repositories. The official repository cannot be removed and is used as the default data source.
repo.name: Name

pim.title: PIM Standalone Plugin
pim.installed_tip: PIM is installed as a standalone plugin. You can manage it in the plugin management page.
pim.desc: Run the WebUI Plugin Installation Manager (PIM) as a standalone plugin to provide installation support for other plugins. If you are not sure what this is, please do not install it.

login.go_chat: I'm a player, I need to access the server chat page
